Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a pink pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively fine, both the interior and exterior are covered with a burnished cream-coloured slip, with remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink on each side.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394522) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394522)
